Class Controller

Controller.Controller
public class Controller extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Controller(IRepository repository)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    allSteps()
    All the steps of the program state execution First gets the current program state out of the program state list Second prints it to the log file Third displays Fourth enters a loop that, while the stack is NOT empty, keeps repeating oneStep and printing into the log file As such, every statement will be popped from within oneStep one-by-one and executed until stack is empty
    PrgState
    oneStep(PrgState state)
    One step of the program state execution First makes a copy of the exeStack Second checks if the stack isn't empty Third creates an IStatement to keep a hold of the top-most statement/first statement Fourth updates the exeStack without the first statement that we popped Fifth executes the popped statement
    void
    setDisplayFlag(boolean value)
    Setter for the displayFlag (used to check if user wants the program to be shown step-by-step)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • setDisplayFlag

      public void setDisplayFlag(boolean value)
      Setter for the displayFlag (used to check if user wants the program to be shown step-by-step)
      Parameters:
      value - = the displayFlag's new value

    • oneStep

      public PrgState oneStep(PrgState state) throws ADTException, EvaluateException, ExecuteException
      One step of the program state execution First makes a copy of the exeStack Second checks if the stack isn't empty Third creates an IStatement to keep a hold of the top-most statement/first statement Fourth updates the exeStack without the first statement that we popped Fifth executes the popped statement
      Parameters:
      state - = the program state
      Returns:
      Returns the execution of the popped/first statement
      Throws:
      ADTException - If the stack is empty
      ExecuteException - If execute throws exception
      EvaluateException

    • allSteps

      public void allSteps() throws EvaluateException, IOException, ADTException, ExecuteException
      All the steps of the program state execution First gets the current program state out of the program state list Second prints it to the log file Third displays Fourth enters a loop that, while the stack is NOT empty, keeps repeating oneStep and printing into the log file As such, every statement will be popped from within oneStep one-by-one and executed until stack is empty
      Throws:
      ExecuteException - If oneStep() throws Exception
      IOException - If logPrgStateExec() throws IOException
      EvaluateException
      ADTException
